risks.patient_advise: Follow a low-carb, high-fiber diet to improve your cholesterol levels. Aim to exercise regularly, such as brisk walking for 30 minutes, 5 days a week. A balanced diet could reduce cholesterol level by 40%.

risks.patient_advise: Follow the prescribed diet plan to reduce your carbohydrate intake and increase your physical activity. Regularly monitor your glucose levels as advised by your doctor.
risks.therapeutic_goal: Reduce fasting glucose levels to below 100 mg/dL.

risks.doctor_advise: Prescribe a weight management program that includes a balanced diet and regular physical activity. Recommend regular follow-ups to monitor weight loss progress.
risks.observations: The patient has a high BMI (35.92 kg/m²), which significantly increases the risk of diabetes. Each 1 kg/m² increase in BMI increases risk by 1-3%.
risks.patient_advise: Follow the prescribed weight management program to achieve a healthy weight. Regularly monitor your progress as advised by your doctor.
risks.therapeutic_goal: Reduce BMI to below 25 kg/m² through a balanced diet and regular physical activity.
